title: NewsBreak - European Markets Gain as U.S. and China Agree to Hold More Trade Talks
text:
NewsBreak - European Markets Gain as U.S. and China Agree to Hold More Trade Talks

Stock Markets 3 hours ago (Sep 05, 2019 03:24AM ET)

© Reuters. Investing.com -- Europe's stock markets gained in early trading and U.S. stock futures were higher after the U.S. and China announced they would resume in early October, raising hopes for a resolution to the protracted trade war between the world's two largest economies. opens up 0.4%, +0.6%, +0.6% Stocks jumped in Asia: Japan’s +2%, China’s +1% U.S. futures rise: +0.5%, +0.6% +0.7%

NewsBreak - European Markets Gain as U.S. and China Agree to Hold More Trade Talks
description: NewsBreak - European Markets Gain as U.S. and China Agree to Hold More Trade Talks
